soundFxTaxonomy.name: Ambient Environment
soundFxTaxonomy.description: Background sounds that establish location, time of day, and overall mood. Typically looped and low-frequency-filtered based on distance.

subcategories.name: Coliseum Ambient
subcategories.description: Murmurs of the crowd, distant chants, stone echo, subtle wind in the arena.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Loop continuously while the player is inside the arena. Cross-fade between day/night variants on time-of-day change. Apply distance attenuation; near the centre play louder, farther away apply a low-pass filter.

subcategories.name: City / Marketplace Ambient
subcategories.description: Street vendors shouting, distant bells, bustling foot traffic, distant horse hooves.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play in outdoor city zones. Use random-selection to avoid repetition. Blend with location-specific reverb presets (e.g., narrow alleys vs. open plazas).

subcategories.name: Dungeon / Underground Ambient
subcategories.description: Dripping water, distant echoes, faint wind, scuttling insects.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Loop while in any underground or dungeon area. Modulate volume based on proximity to water sources or open chambers.

subcategories.name: Forest / Wilderness Ambient
subcategories.description: Leaves rustling, birdsong, distant animal calls, wind through trees.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Loop in any natural outdoor area. Use a layered approach: base wind + occasional bird calls, randomly triggered animal noises.

subcategories.name: Temple / Sacred Ambient
subcategories.description: Echoing chants, distant organ tones, subtle choir hum.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play inside religious or ceremonial structures. Use low-pass filtering when the player is outside the doorway.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Footsteps & Movement
soundFxTaxonomy.description: All locomotion sounds for players, NPCs, and monsters, varying by surface type and armor weight.

subcategories.name: Stone / Marble Floor
subcategories.description: Hard clacking footsteps appropriate for the arena, coliseum floor, or temple interiors.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Select heavy vs. light variant based on character weight (gladiator vs. agile mage). Randomize between 3-4 samples. Apply distance attenuation and surface-specific reverb.

subcategories.name: Sand / Dust
subcategories.description: Soft shuffling sound for desert arenas or dusty streets.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when the player walks on sand-filled sections of the arena or market streets after a sandstorm. Use a low-pass filter for distant steps.

subcategories.name: Wooden Deck / Bridge
subcategories.description: Creaking wooden footfalls for bridges, ship decks, or wooden arena sections.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Add occasional board creak on heavy steps for realism. Randomize between light/heavy samples.

subcategories.name: Grass / Meadow
subcategories.description: Soft rustle of blades of grass underfoot.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Used in forest outskirts, training fields, or open plazas with grass. Blend with ambient wind for natural feel.

subcategories.name: Water / Shallow Stream
subcategories.description: Splashy footfalls when walking through water or a shallow pool.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger when the player enters water volumes. Apply a wet reverb preset.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Combat Weapon Sounds
soundFxTaxonomy.description: All audio cues for weapon swings, unsheathe/sheath, and melee actions.

subcategories.name: Sword Swings
subcategories.description: Whoosh and metallic swish for short-blade attacks.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on each attack animation trigger. Use different samples for light (quick slash) vs. heavy (overhead) attacks. Add a subtle wind-like trailing effect for fast combos.

subcategories.name: Sword Impacts
subcategories.description: Clash, clang, and flesh impact for sword hits on armor, shields, or bodies.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Select impact type based on material hit (use a runtime material lookup). Randomize between 3-4 variations. Apply volume scaling with hit strength.

subcategories.name: Spear Thrust
subcategories.description: Sharp piercing whoosh and impact thud.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger at the moment of tip contact. Use a distinct “piercing” sound for armor vs. flesh. Add a short trailing air-whoosh for long thrusts.

subcategories.name: Axe Swing
subcategories.description: Heavy whoosh and deep chop.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on each swing; heavier than swords, so increase low-frequency content. Use “whoosh” for wind-cutting and “impact” for hit.

subcategories.name: Mace / Flail Swing
subcategories.description: Whirling metallic clang and impact thud.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Add a subtle rattling sound while the weapon is in motion. Impacts should be weighty and have a short reverberation.
subcategories.spatialization: 3D, with emphasis on mid-high frequencies for the rattling.

subcategories.name: Weapon Unsheathe / Sheath
subcategories.description: Metallic scrape and clink when drawing or stowing a weapon.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on animation events for drawing/sheathing. Use separate samples for light vs. heavy weapons.
subcategories.spatialization: 2D (UI-type) or 3D if close to the camera; typically heard in the immediate vicinity.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Combat Impact & Damage
soundFxTaxonomy.description: Sounds related to hits, blocks, armor clanks, grunt/pain, death, and blood splatter.

subcategories.name: Armor Clank
subcategories.description: Metallic clang when two pieces of armor collide or a shield blocks.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on shield block events or when two armored characters clash. Randomize between light/heavy variants based on the relative mass.

subcategories.name: Shield Block
subcategories.description: Sharp metallic block sound with a brief reverberation.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on successful block animation. Mix with a subtle “whoosh” if the block is timed perfectly (perfect block cue).

subcategories.name: Grunt / Pain Vocalizations
subcategories.description: Short vocal sounds for players and NPCs taking damage.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Select based on character type and damage severity. Randomize to avoid repetition. Add slight pitch variation for heavier hits.

subcategories.name: Death Cry
subcategories.description: Final gasp or roar when a character or monster dies.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play once per death. Ensure the sound is not cut off by other events; consider a slight delay after the death animation to avoid clipping with impact sounds.
subcategories.spatialization: 3D, with a small reverb tail for dramatic effect.

subcategories.name: Blood Splatter / Gore Impact
subcategories.description: Squelch and spray sounds for heavy blows that cause visible blood.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on high-damage hits where visual blood is shown. Use a short, low-volume splash that quickly fades to avoid audio clutter.

subcategories.name: Weapon Parry / Counter
subcategories.description: Sharp metallic “ping” for a perfectly timed parry.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play only on perfect timing windows (e.g., when a skill timer registers a parry). Often combined with a visual flash cue.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Creature Sounds
soundFxTaxonomy.description: All animal, monster, and mystical creature vocalizations, movement, and special abilities.

subcategories.name: Dragon Roar
subcategories.description: Deep, resonant roar used for intimidation, attacks, and idle breathing.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on dragon spawn, before a fire breath, or on death. Use heavy low-frequency boost and a long reverb tail. Consider layering a subtle wind whoosh for added presence.
subcategories.spatialization: 3D, with massive radius; apply a custom reverb preset for cavernous spaces.

subcategories.name: Dragon Wing Flap
subcategories.description: Whooshing sound of massive wings beating the air.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on take-off, landing, or during aerial combat. Use a low-pass filter for distant flaps.

subcategories.name: Dragon Fire Breath
subcategories.description: Incendiary whoosh and crackle as the dragon exhales flame.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the start of the fire breath animation; the whoosh precedes the crackle. Combine with fire impact sounds on hit.

subcategories.name: Ogre Grunts & Roars
subcategories.description: Deep guttural grunts, angry roars, and vocalizations for ogre characters.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play idle grunts randomly when the ogre is idle, roars on attack, and pain grunts on being hit. Use lower pitch for larger ogres.

subcategories.name: Ogre Footsteps
subcategories.description: Heavy thuds on stone or earth as an ogre walks.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Use for large NPCs or boss encounters. Randomize timing to avoid mechanical feel. Apply a low-pass filter for distant ogre movement.

subcategories.name: Mystical Beast Roar (e.g., Chimera, Hydra)
subcategories.description: Unique, eerie roars for other mystical enemies.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on spawn, special attack, or death. Add a subtle echo to emphasize otherworldly nature.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Magic & Spell Sounds
soundFxTaxonomy.description: All auditory cues related to casting, charging, projectile travel, impact, area effects, and buffs/debuffs.

subcategories.name: Spell Cast Initiation
subcategories.description: Short incantation or magical whoosh at the moment a spell is triggered.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the exact frame when the caster’s hand or staff begins to move. Use a different timbre per elemental school. Add a subtle “rise” pitch for charge-type spells.
subcategories.spatialization: 2D UI-type or 3D if the caster is in view; usually heard in the immediate vicinity.

subcategories.name: Spell Charge / Build-up
subcategories.description: Rising tone or hum while a spell is being charged (e.g., a powerful area spell).
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped with a short fade-in/out. Stop when the spell is released or interrupted. Modulate pitch based on charge percent.
subcategories.spatialization: 3D with distance attenuation; volume decreases with distance from caster.

subcategories.name: Projectile Travel
subcategories.description: Whoosh or humming for fireballs, ice shards, lightning bolts, etc.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play from the projectile’s start point to its impact. Use a slight Doppler effect for fast projectiles. Randomize minor pitch variations.

subcategories.name: Spell Impact / Explosion
subcategories.description: Impact thuds, elemental bursts, and reverberations when a spell hits.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Select based on element and surface (e.g., fire on wood vs. fire on stone). Layer a low-frequency boom for area spells.
subcategories.spatialization: 3D, with radius-based attenuation for AoE spells.

subcategories.name: Buff / Debuff Aura
subcategories.description: Subtle hums, chimes, or whispers indicating a status effect is active.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped while the effect is active on a character. Fade in/out on apply/remove. Use a distinct timbre per buff category for player recognition.

subcategories.name: Spell Success / Fail UI Cue
subcategories.description: Short chime for a successful cast, a low buzz for a failed or interrupted spell.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on UI layer after the cast resolves. Use a bright, high-pitched tone for success; a dull, descending tone for failure.

subcategories.name: Teleport / Portal
subcategories.description: Woosh and shimmering crackle when a character teleports or a portal opens.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on the origin point for teleport out, and destination point for teleport in. Use a short, high-frequency sparkle for portal activation.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Item Interaction
soundFxTaxonomy.description: Sounds for picking up, using, equipping, consuming, and inventory management.

subcategories.name: Item Pickup
subcategories.description: Light chime or metallic clang when an item is collected.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on the exact frame the item disappears from the world. Use a higher-pitched chime for small items, a deeper clang for heavier gear.
subcategories.spatialization: 3D, source at item location; also a UI overlay cue (optional).

subcategories.name: Item Equip / Unequip
subcategories.description: Metallic snap and cloth rustle when armor or gear is equipped or removed.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Triggered by inventory UI actions. Add a subtle “whoosh” if the character performs a quick draw after equipping.
subcategories.spatialization: 2D UI or 3D if the character is visible.

subcategories.name: Potion / Consumable Use
subcategories.description: Glug, fizz, or magical pop when a consumable is used.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the moment the consumable animation finishes. Add a small “whoosh” if the potion is thrown.

subcategories.name: Chest / Container Open
subcategories.description: Wooden creak and metallic latch click when a chest or crate is opened.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on the animation event for the lid opening. Follow with a faint “ding” for any loot that appears.

subcategories.name: Gold / Coin Jingle
subcategories.description: Clinking coins, used for money transactions, loot drops, and vending.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped for a short burst when many coins are dropped. Use a bright, high-frequency jingle for small amounts, deeper for large piles.
subcategories.spatialization: 2D UI layer (optional) and 3D for large piles.

subcategories.name: Weapon/Armor Break
subcategories.description: Creaking metal or shattering sound when a piece of gear breaks.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when durability reaches zero. Use a sharp crack for metal, a splintering sound for wood.
subcategories.spatialization: 3D, at the location of the broken item.

subcategories.name: Crafting / Upgrade
subcategories.description: Hammering, welding, or magical forge sounds for crafting or upgrading gear.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Layer multiple sounds for a rich crafting experience: a low hammer hit, a mid-frequency forge hum, and a high-pitch sparkle for magical upgrades.
subcategories.spatialization: 2D UI or 3D if the player is near a crafting station.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Environmental Ambience
soundFxTaxonomy.description: Background loops and subtle environmental noises for different zones (coliseum, marketplace, forest, cavern, etc.).

subcategories.name: Coliseum Crowd Murmur
subcategories.description: Low-volume chatter, distant applause, and occasional cheers.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped with a long fade-in. Use a wide stereo spread. Adjust volume based on the player’s position (e.g., louder when near the arena’s edge).
subcategories.spatialization: 2D ambient layer; optionally linked to a reverb zone.

subcategories.name: Marketplace Ambient
subcategories.description: Vendor shouts, barter calls, distant animal sounds, and faint foot traffic.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped with occasional random voice lines (e.g., “Fresh fish!”). Use a slightly higher-frequency mix than the coliseum to convey openness.

subcategories.name: Forest Ambient
subcategories.description: Birdsong, rustling leaves, distant animal calls.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped with occasional random events (e.g., a sudden owl hoot). Use a wide stereo field.
subcategories.spatialization: 2D ambient with subtle 3D positioning for occasional directional cues.

subcategories.name: Cave / Dungeon Drip
subcategories.description: Water droplets and echoing drips in underground areas.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped, with random timing variations to simulate natural drips.

subcategories.name: Wind / Storm
subcategories.description: Rising wind, distant thunder, and rain for weather effects.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Layered based on weather intensity. Use a low-pass filter for distant thunder. Adjust volume based on player exposure (e.g., inside vs. outside).
subcategories.spatialization: 2D ambient with optional 3D reverb for outdoor zones.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: UI & Menu Sounds
soundFxTaxonomy.description: All non-diegetic sounds that provide feedback for menus, button presses, selections, and other interface interactions.

subcategories.name: Button Click
subcategories.description: Soft click for UI button presses.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on every UI interaction. Use a low volume to avoid masking game audio. Slightly pitch-shift for “confirm” vs. “cancel” actions if desired.

subcategories.name: Menu Open / Close
subcategories.description: Subtle swoosh or chime when a menu opens or closes.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the start of the UI transition animation. Use a short, high-frequency tone for opening, a descending tone for closing.

subcategories.name: Inventory Slot Select
subcategories.description: Soft tick when navigating inventory slots.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on each navigation input. Keep volume low so it doesn't interfere with combat sounds.

subcategories.name: Skill Unlock / Level Up
subcategories.description: Bright chime or fanfare for progression events.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play once the player confirms the unlock. Use a distinct, uplifting timbre to reinforce achievement.

subcategories.name: Error / Invalid Action
subcategories.description: Low buzz or buzzer when an invalid action is attempted.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on invalid button press, insufficient resources, or cooldown attempt. Keep volume moderate to avoid frustration.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Cinematic & Narrative
soundFxTaxonomy.description: Music cues, narration, cut-scene sounds, and dramatic transitions.

subcategories.name: Cinematic Music Cue
subcategories.description: Full-orchestral tracks used during story cut-scenes.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Cross-fade with gameplay music. Use a dedicated audio bus with higher master volume to ensure prominence.

subcategories.name: Narration / Voice-over
subcategories.description: Storytelling voice lines for cut-scenes or tutorial guidance.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play after the cinematic visuals begin. Use a clean, clear voice with slight reverb for epic moments.
subcategories.spatialization: 2D mono or stereo, depending on source material.

subcategories.name: Transition Swish
subcategories.description: Quick swish for scene changes or fast cuts.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the exact frame of a visual transition (e.g., fade-out). Keep short and high-frequency to avoid masking dialogue.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: UI & Menu Sounds
soundFxTaxonomy.description: Duplicate category for completeness; includes all generic UI feedback not covered elsewhere.

subcategories.name: General Confirmation
subcategories.description: Short positive chime when an action is confirmed.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play after any confirm button press (e.g., 'OK', 'Accept'). Keep volume modest to stay in the background.

subcategories.name: General Cancel
subcategories.description: Low descending tone when an action is cancelled.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when the player backs out of a menu or aborts an action.

soundFxTaxonomy.name: Ambient Music Loops
soundFxTaxonomy.description: Background music tracks that loop per zone or situation (e.g., arena, exploration, boss fight).

subcategories.name: Arena Theme
subcategories.description: Driving rhythmic track for gladiatorial combat in the coliseum.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped with seamless cross-fade at loop point. Increase intensity (add percussion layer) when a boss appears.

subcategories.name: Exploration Theme
subcategories.description: Ambient melodic music for wandering the city, markets, or open world.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Cross-fade between different area tracks based on player location. Keep volume lower than combat music to allow clear hearing of gameplay sounds.

subcategories.name: Boss Fight Theme
subcategories.description: Intense, high-energy track for major encounters (e.g., dragon, ogre warlord).
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Fade in when the boss health bar appears. Use a dramatic drum hit on phase changes.

subcategories.name: Victory / Triumph
subcategories.description: Uplifting fanfare after winning a battle or completing a quest.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play after the combat ends and before any UI rewards screen. Use a short, crescendoing melody.

subcategories.name: Defeat / Game Over
subcategories.description: Somber, low-tempo track for defeat scenarios.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play after player death when no respawn is immediate. Fade in slowly to match the visual mood.

categories.name: General Gameplay
categories.description: Core sounds that are used throughout the game regardless of specific actions, such as UI feedback, basic movement, and environmental ambience.

subcategories.name: UI Click / Confirm
subcategories.description: Short, crisp click sound used for confirming selections, button presses, and menu navigation.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on every UI interaction event. Use a subtle pitch variation to avoid monotony. Keep the volume low enough to not interfere with gameplay audio.

subcategories.name: UI Cancel / Back
subcategories.description: A soft, descending tone indicating a cancel or back action.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when the player navigates back or cancels an action. Use a slightly lower pitch than the confirm sound.

subcategories.name: Error / Invalid Action
subcategories.description: Low buzz or buzzer sound for invalid actions or error notifications.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on attempts that fail due to cooldowns, insufficient resources, or out-of-range actions. Keep the sound short and distinct.

subcategories.name: Footsteps (Generic)
subcategories.description: Footstep sounds for the player walking on various surfaces (stone, wood, metal, etc.).
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play based on the surface material detected under the player. Randomize between a small set of variations to prevent repetitive patterns. Adjust volume based on player speed (walk vs. run).

subcategories.name: Player Jump
subcategories.description: A light, airy sound when the player jumps.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the start of the jump animation. If the player lands on a different surface, trigger the appropriate footstep sound on landing.

subcategories.name: Player Land
subcategories.description: A soft thud or impact sound when the player lands from a jump or fall.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on landing. Vary pitch based on the height of the fall for realism.

subcategories.name: Ambient Crowd Murmur (Coliseum)
subcategories.description: Low-volume chatter, distant applause, and occasional cheers that give life to the arena.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track with occasional random cheer spikes. Volume should be subtle, rising slightly during key moments (e.g., when a champion enters).

subcategories.name: Environmental Ambience (Marketplace)
subcategories.description: Background chatter of vendors, distant animal sounds, and faint market music.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track for market areas. Add occasional random voice lines (e.g., vendor shouts) to keep it lively.

subcategories.name: Environmental Ambience (Forest)
subcategories.description: Birdsong, rustling leaves, distant animal calls.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track for forest zones. Randomize certain events like owl hoots for variation.

categories.name: Combat
categories.description: Sounds directly related to combat actions, including attacks, hits, blocks, parries, and impact feedback.

subcategories.name: Attack Swing
subcategories.description: A swooshing sound that accompanies a weapon swing, regardless of hit or miss.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the start of the attack animation. Use a slight pitch variation for left/right swings or different weapon types.

subcategories.name: Attack Hit (Generic)
subcategories.description: A sharp impact sound for a successful hit on an opponent.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger when an attack lands on an enemy. Layer with a subtle low-frequency thud for heavier weapons.

subcategories.name: Attack Miss
subcategories.description: A light whoosh indicating a missed attack.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when an attack animation ends without registering a hit. Keep the sound subtle to not distract the player.

subcategories.name: Block / Parry
subcategories.description: A metallic clang or thunk when the player successfully blocks or parries an incoming attack.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on a successful block/parry event. Use a higher-pitch clang for light weapons and a deeper thud for heavy armor.

subcategories.name: Dodge Roll
subcategories.description: A swift whoosh or slide sound as the player performs a dodge roll.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the start of the roll animation. Add a subtle trailing wind effect for longer rolls.

subcategories.name: Critical Hit
subcategories.description: A sharp, high-impact sound combined with a brief metallic ring for critical strikes.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on a critical hit event. Layer a short, bright chime on top of the normal hit sound for emphasis.

subcategories.name: Weapon Clash (Heavy)
subcategories.description: A resonant clang for heavy weapons colliding (e.g., swords, axes).
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on weapon-to-weapon contact, such as during parries or enemy attacks. Use a longer decay to convey weight.

subcategories.name: Weapon Clash (Light)
subcategories.description: A lighter, quicker clang for fast weapons (e.g., daggers).
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on light weapon contacts. Shorter decay than heavy clashes.

categories.name: Special Moves
categories.description: Unique audio cues for special attacks, abilities, and skill activations that differentiate them from regular attacks.

subcategories.name: Power Strike
subcategories.description: A deep, resonant whoosh followed by a heavy impact when the player performs a charged or power attack.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the whoosh at the start of the charge, then the impact on hit. Add a subtle low-frequency rumble for very heavy weapons.

subcategories.name: Whirlwind Attack
subcategories.description: A swirling wind sound combined with metallic slashes for area-of-effect spin attacks.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the wind sound continuously during the spin, layered with periodic slash sounds. Fade out when the attack ends.

subcategories.name: Shield Bash
subcategories.description: A heavy thump followed by a metallic clang when a shield is used to strike.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the thump at impact, then the clang as the shield rebounds. Keep both sounds short to avoid clutter.

subcategories.name: Finisher Move
subcategories.description: A dramatic, high-intensity sound cue for executing a finishing move on an enemy.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on the final blow of a finisher animation. Pair the impact sound with a brief, low-pitch scream for added drama.

subcategories.name: Magic Burst (Skill Activation)
subcategories.description: A bright, shimmering sound that signals the activation of a magical skill.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the exact moment the skill is activated. Add a subtle reverb for a more epic feel.

categories.name: Movement
categories.description: Sounds associated with the player’s locomotion, including walking, running, sprinting, and vehicle/horse riding.

subcategories.name: Walk
subcategories.description: Light footsteps on various surfaces.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on each step while the player is moving at a normal walking speed. Randomize between 2-3 variations per surface.

subcategories.name: Run
subcategories.description: Faster, louder footstep sounds for running.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on each step while running. Increase volume slightly compared to walking. Randomize pitch within a small range.

subcategories.name: Sprint
subcategories.description: Intense footstep sounds with a subtle wind rush for high-speed movement.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play while sprinting. Add a low-volume wind whoosh to emphasize speed. Ensure the sound does not mask combat audio.

subcategories.name: Horse Ride
subcategories.description: Rhythmic hoofbeats and occasional reins creak while riding a horse.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Loop hoofbeats according to the horse’s gait. Play reins creak when the player adjusts speed or direction.

subcategories.name: Vehicle Engine (If applicable)
subcategories.description: Low rumble and rev sounds for any vehicle the player may use.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play idle engine when stationary, rev when accelerating. Loop idle sound; play rev as a one-shot.

categories.name: Combat
categories.description: Sounds directly related to combat actions, including attacks, hits, blocks, parries, and impact feedback.

subcategories.name: Attack Swing
subcategories.description: Swoosh sound for weapon swings.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the start of an attack animation. Vary pitch slightly for left/right swings.

subcategories.name: Attack Hit (Generic)
subcategories.description: Sharp impact sound when a weapon lands on an opponent.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on successful hits. Add a low-frequency thud for heavy weapons.

subcategories.name: Attack Miss
subcategories.description: Light whoosh indicating a missed swing.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when an attack does not register a hit. Keep the sound subtle.

subcategories.name: Block / Parry
subcategories.description: Metallic clang or thunk for successful blocks/parries.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on a successful block or parry. Use a higher pitch for light armor, lower for heavy armor.

subcategories.name: Dodge Roll
subcategories.description: Swift whoosh or slide sound as the player rolls to evade.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the start of a dodge roll animation. Add a subtle wind effect for longer rolls.

subcategories.name: Critical Hit
subcategories.description: Sharp, high-impact sound combined with a brief metallic ring for critical strikes.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on a critical hit event. Layer a short, bright chime on top of the normal hit sound.

subcategories.name: Weapon Clash (Heavy)
subcategories.description: Resonant clang for heavy weapons colliding.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on weapon-to-weapon contact, such as during parries or enemy attacks. Use a longer decay to convey weight.

subcategories.name: Weapon Clash (Light)
subcategories.description: Lighter, quicker clang for fast weapons.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on light weapon contacts. Shorter decay than heavy clashes.

categories.name: Special Moves
categories.description: Unique audio cues for special attacks, abilities, and skill activations that differentiate them from regular attacks.

subcategories.name: Power Strike
subcategories.description: Deep, resonant whoosh followed by a heavy impact for a charged attack.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the whoosh at charge start, then the impact on hit. Add a subtle low-frequency rumble for very heavy weapons.

subcategories.name: Whirlwind Attack
subcategories.description: Swirling wind sound combined with metallic slashes for area-of-effect spin attacks.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the wind sound continuously during the spin, layered with periodic slash sounds. Fade out when the attack ends.

subcategories.name: Shield Bash
subcategories.description: Heavy thump followed by a metallic clang when a shield is used to strike.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the thump at impact, then the clang as the shield rebounds. Keep both sounds short to avoid clutter.

subcategories.name: Finisher Move
subcategories.description: Dramatic, high-intensity sound cue for executing a finishing move.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on the final blow of a finisher animation. Pair the impact sound with a brief, low-pitch scream for added drama.

subcategories.name: Magic Burst (Skill Activation)
subcategories.description: Bright, shimmering sound signaling the activation of a magical skill.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the exact moment the skill is activated. Add a subtle reverb for a more epic feel.

categories.name: Environmental Interactions
categories.description: Sounds related to interacting with the game world, such as opening doors, breaking objects, or interacting with NPCs.

subcategories.name: Door Open
subcategories.description: Creaking sound when a door is opened.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when the player interacts with a door. Use a low-pitch variation for heavy doors.

subcategories.name: Door Close
subcategories.description: Creaking sound when a door is closed.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when the player closes a door or when a door closes automatically.

subcategories.name: Chest Open
subcategories.description: A metallic click followed by a faint magical chime when opening a treasure chest.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play click first, then the chime if the chest contains magical items.

subcategories.name: Object Break (Wooden)
subcategories.description: Creaking and snapping sound for breaking wooden objects.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger when a wooden object is destroyed. Use both sounds together for realism.

subcategories.name: Object Break (Stone)
subcategories.description: Sharp cracking sound for breaking stone objects.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger when stone objects are destroyed. Add a low-frequency rumble for larger objects.

subcategories.name: NPC Interaction (Talk)
subcategories.description: Soft voice line when the player talks to an NPC.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the appropriate line based on the dialogue context. Ensure the volume is lower than combat sounds.

subcategories.name: NPC Interaction (Quest Item Pickup)
subcategories.description: Subtle chime when the player picks up a quest item.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play once when a quest item is collected. Use a bright, short sound to signal importance.

categories.name: Special Moves
categories.description: Unique audio cues for special attacks, abilities, and skill activations that differentiate them from regular attacks.

subcategories.name: Power Strike
subcategories.description: Deep, resonant whoosh followed by a heavy impact when the player performs a charged or power attack.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the whoosh at the start of the charge, then the impact on hit. Add a subtle low-frequency rumble for very heavy weapons.

subcategories.name: Whirlwind Attack
subcategories.description: Swirling wind sound combined with metallic slashes for area-of-effect spin attacks.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the wind sound continuously during the spin, layered with periodic slash sounds. Fade out when the attack ends.

subcategories.name: Shield Bash
subcategories.description: Heavy thump followed by a metallic clang when a shield is used to strike.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play the thump at impact, then the clang as the shield rebounds. Keep both sounds short to avoid clutter.

subcategories.name: Finisher Move
subcategories.description: Dramatic, high-intensity sound cue for executing a finishing move on an enemy.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Trigger on the final blow of a finisher animation. Pair the impact sound with a brief, low-pitch scream for added drama.

subcategories.name: Magic Burst (Skill Activation)
subcategories.description: Bright, shimmering sound that signals the activation of a magical skill.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the exact moment the skill is activated. Add a subtle reverb for a more epic feel.

categories.name: Environment
categories.description: Ambient and environmental sounds that set the mood and atmosphere of the game world.

subcategories.name: Wind
subcategories.description: Soft wind blowing through trees or across plains.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track. Volume varies based on player location (higher in open areas).

subcategories.name: Water Flow (River)
subcategories.description: Gentle flowing water sound for rivers and streams.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track near water bodies. Add occasional splashing for realism.

subcategories.name: Fire Crackle
subcategories.description: campfire or torches.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play near sources of fire. Loop with occasional pops for variation.

subcategories.name: Bird Chirps
subcategories.description: Various bird calls to enrich forest and meadow areas.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Randomly trigger at intervals. Adjust volume based on player proximity to foliage.

categories.name: UI
categories.description: User interface sounds for menus, selections, and notifications.

subcategories.name: Menu Open
subcategories.description: Soft chime when opening a menu.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when any UI menu is opened. Keep volume low to avoid distraction.

subcategories.name: Menu Close
subcategories.description: Soft chime when closing a menu.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when any UI menu is closed. Consistent with the open sound.

subcategories.name: Button Click
subcategories.description: Light click sound for button interactions.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play on any button press in the UI. Slight pitch variation to reduce repetition.

subcategories.name: Notification Alert
subcategories.description: Brief alert tone for in-game notifications (e.g., quest updates).
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when a new notification appears. Ensure it is audible over ambient sounds.

subcategories.name: Inventory Item Pick Up
subcategories.description: Subtle chime when picking up items.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play each time the player adds an item to the inventory. Use a bright, short sound.

subcategories.name: Error/Invalid Action
subcategories.description: Low buzz or buzzer indicating an invalid action.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when the player attempts an unavailable action (e.g., trying to open a locked door without a key).

categories.name: Ambient
categories.description: Background sounds that set the mood for different environments.

subcategories.name: Ambient Crowd Murmur (Coliseum)
subcategories.description: Low-volume chatter, distant applause, and occasional cheers that give life to the arena.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track with occasional random cheer spikes. Volume should be subtle, rising slightly during key moments (e.g., when a champion enters).

subcategories.name: Environmental Ambience (Marketplace)
subcategories.description: Background chatter of vendors, distant animal sounds, and faint market music.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track for market areas. Add occasional random voice lines (e.g., vendor shouts) to keep it lively.

subcategories.name: Environmental Ambience (Forest)
subcategories.description: Birdsong, rustling leaves, distant animal calls.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track for forest zones. Randomize certain events like owl hoots for variation.

subcategories.name: Water Flow (River)
subcategories.description: Gentle flowing water sound for rivers and streams.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track near water bodies. Add occasional splashing for realism.

subcategories.name: Wind
subcategories.description: Soft wind blowing through trees or across plains.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Looped ambient track. Volume varies based on player location (higher in open areas).

subcategories.name: Fire Crackle
subcategories.description: Campfire or torches.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play near sources of fire. Loop with occasional pops for variation.

subcategories.name: Bird Chirps
subcategories.description: Various bird calls to enrich forest and meadow areas.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Randomly trigger at intervals. Adjust volume based on player proximity to foliage.

categories.name: Dialogue
categories.description: Voice lines for characters, including the player character and NPCs.

subcategories.name: NPC Greeting
subcategories.description: Friendly greeting from an NPC.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when the player initiates conversation with a friendly NPC. Volume should be clear but not overpowering.

subcategories.name: NPC Farewell
subcategories.description: Farewell line from an NPC.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when conversation ends. Consistent tone with greeting.

subcategories.name: Quest Completion
subcategories.description: Celebratory line from an NPC upon quest completion.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when the player completes a quest. Use a distinct, uplifting tone.

categories.name: Music
categories.description: Background music tracks for various gameplay states and areas.

subcategories.name: Exploration Theme
subcategories.description: Gentle, melodic music for exploration.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play during non-combat exploration. Loop with smooth transitions between areas.

subcategories.name: Combat Theme
subcategories.description: Intense, rhythmic music for combat scenarios.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play during combat. Ensure it dynamically fades out when combat ends.

subcategories.name: Boss Battle Theme
subcategories.description: Epic music for boss fights.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play at the start of a boss encounter. Higher intensity and longer duration.

subcategories.name: Victory Theme
subcategories.description: Triumphant music after successful battle.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play after combat ends, before returning to exploration music.

subcategories.name: Defeat Theme
subcategories.description: Somber music upon player defeat.
subcategories.deploymentGuidelines: Play when player health reaches zero. Fade out as the game resets or loads checkpoint.
